DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Lymph Node Extramural Nodule Examined Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a number indicating a quantity of discrete, smooth contoured, aggregations of cells in adipose tissue surrounding the colon evaluated as a mass of lymphatic tissue replaced by metastatic tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Lymph Node Extramural Nodule Examined
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to evaluation for disease in a discrete, smooth contoured, aggregation of cells in adipose tissue surrounding the colon indicating a mass of lymphatic tissue replaced by metastatic tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition:
A small aggregate of cells found in adipose tissues, 
particularly those attached to the colon where the architectural details 
of the lymph node cannot be identified with certainty under the 
microscope. It may represent a lymph node completely replaced by metastatic cancer.
:Examined; having been subjected to an examination.

Concepts.definition: A small aggregate of cells found in adipose tissues, particularly those attached to the colon where the architectural details of the lymph node cannot be identified with certainty under the microscope.  It may represent a lymph node completely replaced by metastatic cancer.
Having been subjected to inspection or evaluation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/11/17 tt transferred context, added reg status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COMMENT_390
ReferenceDocuments.description: Instruction on template form: (enter "99" if unknown)

ReferenceDocuments.name: 2-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Instruction on template form: Note: Any discrete extramural deposits with round or smooth borders should be counted as lymph node metastases. In contrast, irregular deposits are to be regarded as vascular involvement.
